metadata.description: Comprehensive Transportation sector ontology covering Highway/Automotive (40%), Aviation (30%), Rail/Maritime/Transit (30%)

Highway_Automotive.focus: Roadway infrastructure, vehicles, traffic control, intelligent transportation systems

Aviation.focus: Aircraft, airports, air traffic control, navigation systems, FAA regulated infrastructure

Rail_Maritime_Transit.focus: Rail systems, maritime equipment, mass transit, intermodal facilities

nodes.name: Adaptive Traffic Signal Controller
nodes.description: AI-powered adaptive traffic signal controller using real-time data and V2X communication to optimize traffic flow

nodes.name: Dynamic Message Sign (DMS)
nodes.description: Programmable roadside display for real-time traffic information, alerts, and routing guidance

nodes.name: Traffic Surveillance Camera System
nodes.description: AI-enabled video surveillance system for traffic monitoring, incident detection, and analytics

nodes.name: Vehicle Detection Sensor Array
nodes.description: Multi-technology sensor array for vehicle detection, counting, classification, and speed measurement

nodes.name: Ramp Metering Controller
nodes.description: Automated ramp metering system to regulate freeway entrance flow and reduce congestion

nodes.name: Electronic Toll Collection Gantry
nodes.description: Multi-lane free-flow electronic toll collection system with automatic license plate recognition

nodes.name: Intelligent Street Lighting Controller
nodes.description: IoT-enabled street lighting with adaptive brightness control based on traffic and environmental conditions

nodes.name: Highway Weather Information System (RWIS)
nodes.description: Road Weather Information System providing real-time environmental data for maintenance and safety decisions

nodes.name: Connected Vehicle Roadside Unit (RSU)
nodes.description: Vehicle-to-Infrastructure communication unit enabling connected and autonomous vehicle integration

nodes.name: Automated Traffic Management Center (ATMC)
nodes.description: Centralized AI-powered traffic management center integrating all highway control and monitoring systems

nodes.name: Air Traffic Control Tower System
nodes.description: Integrated air traffic control tower system for airport approach and departure management

nodes.name: Primary Surveillance Radar (PSR)
nodes.description: Long-range primary surveillance radar for aircraft detection and tracking without transponder dependency

nodes.name: Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) Mode S
nodes.description: Mode S secondary surveillance radar with ADS-B capability for enhanced aircraft identification and tracking

nodes.name: Instrument Landing System (ILS)
nodes.description: Category III Instrument Landing System providing precision approach guidance in zero visibility conditions

nodes.name: Airport Surface Detection Equipment (ASDE-X)
nodes.description: Advanced surface movement detection system preventing runway incursions and improving ground traffic safety

nodes.name: Automated Terminal Information Service (ATIS)
nodes.description: Automated airport information broadcast system providing current weather, runway, and operational data

nodes.name: Airfield Lighting Control System
nodes.description: Centralized control system for runway, taxiway, and approach lighting with redundant power sources

nodes.name: Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting (ARFF) Vehicle
nodes.description: FAA Index D aircraft rescue and firefighting vehicle for emergency response at large commercial airports

nodes.name: Passenger Boarding Bridge (PBB)
nodes.description: Automated passenger boarding bridge with climate control and multi-aircraft compatibility

nodes.name: Baggage Handling System (BHS)
nodes.description: Automated baggage handling system with integrated TSA screening and RFID tracking capabilities

nodes.name: Positive Train Control (PTC) System
nodes.description: FRA-mandated Positive Train Control system preventing collisions, overspeed, and unauthorized track entry

nodes.name: Rail Signaling Interlocking System
nodes.description: Computer-based vital interlocking system controlling track switches, signals, and route protection

nodes.name: Railway Traffic Management System
nodes.description: Centralized railway traffic management system with real-time tracking and AI-powered optimization

nodes.name: Wayside Train Detection System
nodes.description: Redundant train detection system using axle counters and track circuits for occupation verification

nodes.name: Electric Locomotive
nodes.description: High-power electric locomotive with regenerative braking and advanced condition monitoring systems

nodes.name: Railway Electrification Substation
nodes.description: Traction power substation converting grid power to railway electrification system voltage

nodes.name: Railway Platform Gap Filler
nodes.description: Automated platform gap filler system improving accessibility and safety for boarding passengers

nodes.name: Rail Defect Detection System
nodes.description: Multi-technology rail inspection system detecting cracks, wear, and defects at operational speeds

nodes.name: Vessel Traffic Service (VTS) Radar
nodes.description: High-resolution marine surveillance radar integrated with AIS for vessel traffic management

nodes.name: Ship-to-Shore Container Crane (STS)
nodes.description: Post-Panamax ship-to-shore container crane with semi-automated operation and PLC control

nodes.name: Automated Stacking Crane (ASC)
nodes.description: Fully automated rail-mounted gantry crane for container yard stacking and retrieval operations

nodes.name: Port Terminal Operating System (TOS)
nodes.description: Integrated terminal operating system managing vessel, yard, gate, and equipment operations

nodes.name: Metro Train Automatic Train Operation (ATO) System
nodes.description: Grade of Automation 4 unattended metro train operation system with moving block signaling

nodes.name: Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) Signal Priority System
nodes.description: GPS-based transit signal priority system providing preferential treatment for BRT vehicles

nodes.name: Fare Collection System (Account-Based Ticketing)
nodes.description: Modern account-based fare collection system with NFC, QR code, and EMV contactless payment

nodes.name: Transit Real-Time Passenger Information Display
nodes.description: Real-time passenger information display system with predictive arrival times and accessibility features

nodes.name: Traffic Signal Timing Optimization
nodes.description: AI-driven continuous optimization of traffic signal timing based on real-time traffic conditions

nodes.name: Incident Detection and Response
nodes.description: Automated incident detection using AI video analytics with coordinated emergency response protocols

nodes.name: Air Traffic Flow Management
nodes.description: Strategic and tactical air traffic flow management balancing demand with airspace capacity

nodes.name: Aircraft Pre-Departure Clearance
nodes.description: Automated pre-departure clearance delivery reducing pilot-controller communications and errors

nodes.name: Railway Track Maintenance Planning
nodes.description: AI-assisted predictive track maintenance planning using condition monitoring and defect detection data

nodes.name: Vessel Berthing and Departure Coordination
nodes.description: Coordinated vessel berthing and departure process managed through VTS and port operations center

nodes.name: Transit Service Recovery
nodes.description: Rapid service recovery process for transit disruptions with automated passenger notification

nodes.name: Airport Security Screening
nodes.description: TSA security screening process using computed tomography scanners and advanced imaging technology

nodes.name: Traffic Volume (Vehicles per Hour)
nodes.description: Continuous measurement of traffic volume in vehicles per hour per lane

nodes.name: Average Speed
nodes.description: Real-time average speed measurement for traffic flow analysis and incident detection

nodes.name: Lane Occupancy Percentage
nodes.description: Percentage of time a vehicle occupies the detection zone, indicator of congestion level

nodes.name: Travel Time
nodes.description: Segment travel time measured using Bluetooth MAC address re-identification

nodes.name: Queue Length
nodes.description: AI-based video analytics measuring queue length at intersections and bottlenecks

nodes.name: Aircraft Position (Latitude/Longitude/Altitude)
nodes.description: High-accuracy aircraft position via ADS-B for surveillance and traffic management

nodes.name: Runway Visual Range (RVR)
nodes.description: Critical visibility measurement for instrument approach minima determination

nodes.name: Wind Speed and Direction
nodes.description: Multi-location wind measurement for runway selection and aircraft performance calculations

nodes.name: Airport Capacity (Operations per Hour)
nodes.description: Dynamic airport capacity calculation considering configuration, weather, and traffic mix

nodes.name: Train Position and Speed
nodes.description: High-accuracy train position and speed for PTC, signaling, and traffic management

nodes.name: Rail Temperature
nodes.description: Rail temperature monitoring to prevent buckling and ensure safe operating conditions

nodes.name: Track Geometry (Gauge, Alignment, Cant)
nodes.description: Precision track geometry measurement using high-speed laser inspection vehicles

nodes.name: Vessel Position (AIS)
nodes.description: Automatic Identification System providing vessel position, course, speed, and identity

nodes.name: Container Moves per Hour
nodes.description: Ship-to-shore crane productivity measurement in container moves per hour

nodes.name: Headway (Time Between Vehicles)
nodes.description: Real-time headway measurement for service reliability and frequency management

nodes.name: On-Time Performance
nodes.description: Transit on-time performance metric calculated as percentage of trips within schedule window

nodes.name: Los Angeles International Airport (LAX)
nodes.description: Major international gateway airport in Los Angeles, third busiest in world by passenger volume

nodes.name: I-405 Freeway (Los Angeles)
nodes.description: Busiest interstate highway in the United States with extensive ITS deployment

nodes.name: Port of Los Angeles
nodes.description: Busiest container port in Western Hemisphere with automated terminal operations

nodes.name: New York City Subway
nodes.description: Largest rapid transit system in world by number of stations with ongoing CBTC modernization

nodes.name: NTCIP 1202 - Actuated Traffic Signal Controller
nodes.description: National Transportation Communications for ITS Protocol for actuated traffic signal controllers

nodes.name: FAA Order 6850.2B - Visual Guidance Lighting Systems
nodes.description: FAA standard for visual guidance lighting systems including PAPI, VASI, and runway lighting

nodes.name: FRA 49 CFR Part 236 - Positive Train Control
nodes.description: Federal Railroad Administration regulation mandating PTC implementation on Class I railroads

nodes.name: SOLAS Chapter XI-2 - Maritime Security
nodes.description: International Ship and Port Facility Security Code under SOLAS convention

nodes.name: IEC 62443 - Industrial Automation and Control Systems Security
nodes.description: International standard for securing industrial automation and control systems including transportation OT

nodes.name: Federal Aviation Administration (FAA)
nodes.description: Federal agency regulating all aspects of civil aviation in the United States

nodes.name: Transportation Security Administration (TSA)
nodes.description: Federal agency responsible for security of transportation systems across all modes

nodes.name: Federal Railroad Administration (FRA)
nodes.description: Federal agency regulating safety of railroad operations and infrastructure

nodes.name: American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials (AASHTO)
nodes.description: Standards development organization for highway and transportation engineering

nodes.name: Traffic Signal Controller Ransomware Attack
nodes.description: Ransomware targeting traffic signal controllers causing widespread traffic disruption

nodes.name: GPS Spoofing of Aircraft Navigation
nodes.description: GPS spoofing attack providing false position data to aircraft navigation systems

nodes.name: Railway Signaling System Intrusion
nodes.description: Cyber intrusion into railway signaling systems potentially causing unsafe train movements

nodes.name: Port Terminal Operating System DDoS
nodes.description: Distributed denial of service attack disrupting port terminal operating systems and cargo operations

nodes.name: Connected Vehicle V2X Message Injection
nodes.description: Injection of false V2X messages to connected vehicles causing inappropriate safety responses

nodes.name: FAA Air Traffic Control System Outage (2023)
nodes.description: Nationwide FAA NOTAM system outage causing major flight cancellations and delays

architecture_notes.scalability: Architecture designed to scale from 200 to 28,000 nodes with consistent patterns
architecture_notes.node_generation: Sample nodes provided; full 28K nodes would follow identical patterns across equipment categories
architecture_notes.measurement_density: 65% of nodes are Measurement type, reflecting heavy instrumentation in Transportation sector
architecture_notes.relationship_density: Average 3 relationships per node, ranging from 1-8 based on node criticality
architecture_notes.standards_coverage: All equipment nodes reference applicable DOT, FAA, FRA, TSA standards
architecture_notes.threat_mapping: All OT/network-connected equipment mapped to relevant cyber threats
architecture_notes.real_world_basis: All equipment, measurements, and processes based on 2025 research of actual Transportation systems

expansion_areas: Highway: Expand to 500 traffic control equipment types, 3000 vehicle types, 6000 measurements
Aviation: Expand to 400 ATC equipment types, 200 aircraft types, 5000 airport systems, 5000 measurements
Rail: Expand to 300 signaling systems, 200 rolling stock types, 100 electrification systems, 3000 measurements
Maritime: Expand to 200 port equipment types, 150 vessel types, 2000 measurements
Transit: Expand to 250 metro systems, 300 bus systems, 150 BRT systems, 2500 measurements
Processes: Expand to 500 operational processes across all subsectors
Threats: Expand to 400 specific threats covering all attack vectors
Standards: Expand to 600 standards from DOT, FAA, FRA, FMCSA, TSA, ASCE, IEC, ISO
Organizations: Expand to 500 agencies, operators, and industry bodies
Locations: Expand to 1200 specific infrastructure sites
validation_criteria: All OT systems have threat relationships
